de.rincewind.api.gui.util

Interface EventManager

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    CraftEventManager

    public interface EventManager
    This class handles the events and listeners to some Objects like Element or Window. There are many events could be fired and each of them has one attendant listener-class (Listener). If an event is fired all registered listeners, handling the fired event, will be automatically executed.
    Since:
    2.3.3
    Author:
    Rincewind34
    See Also:
    EventBased

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  EventManager.ListenerBase
      This class is a dummy to let the user decide if the listener to register has to be executed before or after all even registered listeners.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Deprecated Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addListener(Listener<?> listener)
      Deprecated. 
      because of the new EventManager.ListenerBase. It is recommended to use registerListener(Listener)
      <E extends Event<?>>
      void      		 callEvent(E event)
      Executing all registered listeners matching to the fired event.
      java.util.List<Listener<?>> getListeners()
      Returns all registered listeners in the order they may executed on an incoming event.
      java.util.List<Listener<?>> getListeners(java.lang.Class<? extends Event<?>> eventClass)
      Returns all registered listeners matching to a given event-class in the order they may executed on the incoming event.
      EventManager.ListenerBase registerListener(Listener<?> listener)
      Returns a created ListenerBase-instance to register a given listener.

    • Method Detail

      • getListeners

        java.util.List<Listener<?>> getListeners()
        Returns all registered listeners in the order they may executed on an incoming event. If there is no listener registered, this method will return an empty List.
        Returns:
        all registered listeners

      • getListeners

        java.util.List<Listener<?>> getListeners(java.lang.Class<? extends Event<?>> eventClass)
        Returns all registered listeners matching to a given event-class in the order they may executed on the incoming event. If there is no registered listener matching to the given event-class, this method will return an empty List.
        Parameters:
        eventClass - to get the matching listeners
        Returns:
        all registered listeners matching to a given event-class
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the event-class is null

      • registerListener

        EventManager.ListenerBase registerListener(Listener<?> listener)
        Returns a created ListenerBase-instance to register a given listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - to register
        Returns:
        a created ListenerBase-instance to register a given listener
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the listener is null

      • callEvent

        <E extends Event<?>> void callEvent(E event)
        Executing all registered listeners matching to the fired event.
        Parameters:
        event - fired
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the event is null

      • addListener

        @Deprecated
void addListener(Listener<?> listener)
        Deprecated. because of the new EventManager.ListenerBase. It is recommended to use registerListener(Listener)
        Registers a listener.
        Parameters:
        listener - to register
